variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in PINK1 (G1039A) leading to a substitution of arginine at position 347.
A missense mutation in PINK1 (A1366G) causing a glycine substitution at position 456.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant PINK1 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced PINK1 protein stability and impaired mitochondrial function in cells with the G1039A mutation.
Impaired kinase activity and disrupted mitochondrial dynamics in cells with the A1366G mutation.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression level â‰¥ 80% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression level < 50% of wild-type control.
